newsitem.title: UK: Argentina's Banco Bansud plans $100 mln 3-yr bond.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Banco Bansud plans $100 mln 3-yr bond.

text.p: Banco Bansud, one of Argentina's largest private banks, will launch a $100 million three-year bond this week, bankers said on Monday.
The deal is expected to be launched on Wednesday.
Credit Lyonnais is lead manager with Citibank tipped as joint lead manager. Price talk is 200-210 basis points over U.S. Treasury notes.
The bond will be issued off the borrowers' Euro Medium Term Note (EMTN) Programme.
The new three-year deal will offer a yield pick-up over the previous dollar bond, which Banco Bansud launched last November.
The $100 million December 1999, 9.25 percent, bond was priced to yield 365 b.p. over and was last trading at around 190 b.p. bid, dealers said.
"The tight spread is a reflection of the market. Generally spreads have been tightening aggressively within Latin America," an emerging market dealer said.
Last week, Moody's Investors Service downgraded Banco Bansud's financial strength rating to E+ from D.
At the same time, the rating agency confirmed the bank's long-term foreign currency bond and deposit ratings of B1.
